column5: n}}, aged 72 years) was the tenth [[King of Rohan]], and the first King of the second line.

column1: Fréaláf was the son of [[Hild]], and thus the sister-son of [[Helm
column2: Helm Hammerhand]]. When [[Rohan]] was invaded by the [[Dunlendings]] led by [[Wulf]] in {{TA
column3: 2758}}, Fréaláf was among the [[Rohirrim]] who took refuge in [[Dunharrow]]. However King Helm and his sons were killed in the invasion and the siege of the [[Hornburg]] in {{TA
column5: n}}, and Fréaláf was his heir.

column1: Early in the spring Fréaláf led a daring surprise raid against the Dunlendings that recaptured [[Edoras]] and managed to reclaim it. With aid from [[Gondor]], he eventually drove the [[Dunlendings]] back across both the rivers [[Isen]] and [[Adorn]], freeing all of Rohan.<ref name="Eorl">{{App
column2: Eorl}}</ref>  Those Dunlendings who had occupied [[Isengard]] were starved until they capitulated and left the fortress.<ref>{{UT

column1: At his coronation the [[Wizard]] [[Saruman]] suddenly appeared after years of absence. Saruman offered Fréaláf his support and friendship which Fréaláf accepted, as Rohan was just recovering from the war and the [[Long Winter]]. On Fréaláf's advice, [[Beren (Steward of Gondor)
column3: Steward]] of [[Gondor]], lent Saruman the keys to [[Orthanc]], giving him Isengard to dwell in on the condition that he must protect it from another conquest by the Dunlendings.

column1: He ruled for 39 years, and was succeeded by his son [[Brytta
column2: Brytta Léofa]] at his death in 2798.<ref name="Eorl"/>
